qas.question: What is the largest city in the U.S. without formal zoning?
Besides parking requirements, what land use regulations does Houston have?
What is Houston's land use policies credited with producing?
What serious situation of 2008 was Houston spared?
How many building permits were issued in 2008 in Houston?
What is the largest city in the U.S. with formal zoning?
Besides parking requirements, what land use regulations does Texas have?
What is Houston's ocean use policies credited with producing?
What serious situation of 2009 was Houston spared?
How many building permits were issued in 2019 in Houston?

context: Though <a0_0><b5_0>Houston<b5_0/><a0_0/> is the largest city in the United States without formal zoning regulations, it has developed similarly to other Sun Belt cities because the city's land use regulations and legal covenants have played a similar role. Regulations include <a1_0><b6_0>mandatory lot size<b6_0/><a1_0/> for single-family houses and requirements that parking be available to tenants and customers. Such restrictions have had mixed results. Though some have blamed the city's low density, urban sprawl, and lack of pedestrian-friendliness on these policies, the city's land use has also been credited with having significant <a2_0><b7_0>affordable housing<b7_0/><a2_0/>, sparing Houston the worst effects of the 2008 <a3_0><b8_0>real estate crisis<b8_0/><a3_0/>. The city issued <a4_0><b9_0>42,697<b9_0/><a4_0/> building permits in 2008 and was ranked first in the list of healthiest housing markets for 2009.
